content:
Je možné, že už je preplnený priečinok "Doručená pošta" a možno aj "Odoslaná pošta", kde je Thunderbirdom stanovený maximálny objem 4GB (rovnako ako aj pre každý samostatný priečinok). Kliknite na priečinok "Doručená pošta" pravým tlačidlom myši, vyberte "Vlastnosti" a preverte akú veľkosť na disku zaberá. Limit veľkosti zložky je detailnejšie vysvetlený tuná: http://kb.mozillazine.org/Limits_%28Thunderbird%29#Folders_and_messages. = V mnohých prípadoch pomôže opraviť priečinok, - kliknite na priečinok pravým tlačidlom myši a zvoľte "Vlastnosti" a vyberte "Opraviť priečinok": http://imgbank.cz/images/2014/09/23/Thunderbird_opravit_priecinok.jpg - postupne opravte aj ostatné priečinky

Potom je nutné "Vykonať údržbu priečinkov": - Thunderbird - Súbor - Vykonať údržbu priečinkov http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/08/19/Thunderbird_udrzba_priecinkov.jpg

content:
SOLVED In spite of taking all the actions above, I could not solve. As a last resort, I went into Settings/Config Editor followed by layout.css.devPixelsPerPx. The reading was 1.5 and the restore button was showing. I clicked the restore, the pixel size changed and my T'bird display was then correct.

Really do not know what caused this since I have never previously entered into this setting (warnings!) layout.css.devPixelsPerPx. I thought that the problem may have been associated with the recommended Lenovo System/Display scale of 200% ...
creator: RonSH

content:
Assicurati di aver attiva la visualizzazione HTML dei messaggi Premi Alt sulla tastiera per visualizzare/attivare la barra dei menu, poi vai nel menu Visualizza > Corpo del messaggio come e scegli HTML originale

Se il problema non è questo, prova a fare queste operazione di manutenzione dell'archivio:

  1. Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Riavviare Thunderbird
  4. Se il problema non è risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale
  5. Riavviare Thunderbird
  6. Se il problema non si è ancora risolto: click destro sulla cartella che contiene la mail illeggibile -> Proprietà -> [Ripara la cartella]
creator: @next

content: C'è scritto anche nella stessa pagina che hai citato: è una funzione ancora in fase di sviluppo. Al momento non è utilizzabile. Dovrebbe essere disponibile in contemporanea con Thunderbird per Android 8 (attualmente ancora in beta)
creator: @next

content:
Ciao, grazie per la risposta, ma mi permetto di correggerti.

Nella pagina che ho citato, infatti, c'è scritto chiaramente: "This feature is still being developed as part of Thunderbird for Android beta. Upgrade to the latest version of Thunderbird for Android beta for the most up to date version." Ora, non vedo dove esattamente viene detto che la funzione "non è utilizzabile". Al contrario, viene suggerito di aggiornare alla versione beta per poterla usare, il che fa intendere che sia disponibile, almeno in quella versione.

Quindi, mi pare che il problema non sia nella mia lettura della pagina, ma piuttosto in una mancanza di chiarezza da parte di chi ha scritto la documentazione. Se la funzione non è ancora attiva o non funziona come promesso, sarebbe utile che venisse specificato chiaramente, invece di dare l'impressione che sia già utilizzabile. La documentazione e l'app stessa dovrebbero essere allineate, altrimenti si creano solo confusione e false aspettative.

Magari è come dici tu, ma allora qualcuno dovrebbe prendersi la briga di aggiornare le informazioni in modo più chiaro.

Grazie comunque per il feedback.
creator: gagginaspinnata

content: Grazie a te per il pollice giù che è la dimostrazione palese che ad esser gentili si perde tempo. Se la funzione non è implementata in Thunderbird per desktop, puoi scaricare tutte le beta che vuoi di Thunderbird per Android ma la funzione non la potrai usare comunque.
creator: @next

content:
As I understand it, the problem is in locating the profile from the beta to copy to the PC with standard release. The beta's settings are different, so I suggest these steps to identify the beta:

  1. click help>troubleshootinginformation in the beta
  2. scroll down to 'profile ' in left side, and click 'open folder'
  3. exit thunderbird, you are now in the beta, note the exact name and location.
  4. back up one folder and you can then copy the full profile
creator: davidsk

Ik heb het automatisch ophalen van nieuwe mailberichten (stond om de 3 minuten) uitgeschakeld en kijk het een paar dagen aan. Het is niet handig als dit uit moet staan, maar als het probleem niet meer optreedt hebben we in ieder geval de dader te pakken en kijk ik van daar verder.
creator: j.m.ruiter

content:
Inderdaad onhandig. Voor het ophalen van berichten zijn er de volgende sneltoetsen: Nieuwe berichten ophalen voor huidige account F5 Nieuwe berichten ophalen voor alle accounts Shift + F5.

We zijn benieuwd naar het resultaat. Als je het leuk vind en tijd hebt mag je de resultaten ook in de bug melden, zodat de ontwikkelaars hopelijk een oplossing vinden.
creator: Mozilla-assistent

content:
De laatste dagen staat het automatisch ophalen van mail uitgeschakeld en Thunderbird is nog geen enkele keer gecrashed. Het vaak controleren van mail (om de 3 minuten) is kennelijk voor mijn configuratie problematisch.

Ik ga de instelling binnenkort toch weer aanzetten, maar dan minder frequent (beginnend met 1x per half uur of zoiets).
creator: j.m.ruiter

content: We zijn benieuwd naar de resultaten!
creator: markh2

content:
Ik heb de afgelopen dagen mijn Gmail-account op 30 minuten ophaalfrequentie gezet (de twee andere mailboxen die ik heb stonden nog niet op automatisch ophalen). Tot op heden geen enkele crash gehad.

Ik ga nu mijn drie mailboxen allen op een frequentie van 15 minuten zetten. Ten tijde van de crashed stonden deze overigens op respectievelijk 3 (Gmail), 15 en 10 minuten. Het lijkt er op dat de frequente voor Gmail de bottleneck was. Met 15 minuten frequentie ben ik ook tevreden.
creator: j.m.ruiter

content: Dank voor de update. We zien uit naar de volgende resultaten.
creator: Mozilla-assistent

content:
Het automatisch ophalen stond dus eerst op 3 minuten, maar staat de afgelopen dagen op 15 minuten voor alle accounts. Geen enkele crash meer gehad.

Het verlagen van de frequentie van automatisch ophalen heeft het probleem verholpen. Omdat deze instelling voor mij ook prima werkt, vind ik het bij deze voldoende en markeer ik dit antwoord als de probleemoplosser.

content:
These are the settings I use for HotMail and I've never had "a load of junk from office365," just my messages. 

Server Name: outlook.office365.com Port: 993 [995 for POP] User Name: <your e-mail address> Connection security:  SSL/TLS Authentication method: OAuth2


'Outgoing Server (SMTP)':— 

Server Name: smtp.office365.com Port: 587 Connection security: STARTTLS Authentication method:  OAuth2 User Name: <your e-mail address>

  The trouble with looking on-line is that what worked when somebody wrote something may not work now.

If you do get junk and say exactly what it is I may be able to help you get rid of it.

content:
I actually think it might be a password issue. I didnt set the email up initially but I did get the passwords from thunderbird saved passwords but at the initial stages it says password not recognised when I try offline as per one of the suggestions from the support forum.

Try setting up the account offline: checkmark File/Offline/Work Offline, then File/New/Existing Mail Account..., enter the correct settings manually, Click Done to close the account setup window. Then, switch back to online status and see if the account works. Incoming IMAP server: imap.1and1.com on port 993, SSL/TLS, normal password, email address for User name. Outgoing: smtp.1and1.com on port 587, STARTTLS, normal password, email address for User name.

content: To clarify password vs other issues, I recommend setting account up but without password. That generally lets you know if thunderbird has the correct settings. I would delete the account and then go to settings>Privacy&security to verify that the account isn't present and also to check help>troubleshootinginformation to verify that the Mail & News Account table doesn't show it. Then set up without password and wait for a prompt for it after setup. That may not make the account work, but may help. I've never see the message you posted before, and wish I had more substantive advice.

  • klik op Gereed.

content: This is windows issue. You need to go to the default apps app to set the default.
creator: davidsk

content: I found the solution, it is a Thunderbird setting. I went into the Thunderbird app to set Thunderbird as the default mail client. Problem solved. Settings/General/System Integration/Check Always Check to see......./then click on Check Now and you will see a check box to make Thuderbird the default mail client. This check box is buried in the Settings menu. Check it and the Send To link will come to life.
creator: rwliebert

This check box is buried in the Settings menu. Check it and the Send To link will come to life.

content:
I've been dealing with this problem since I finally decided I'd better at least try W11 since MS is determined to force me to do that or switch to a linux distribution. I tried manually setting TB as the default app for email and tried rwliebert's solution (just in case doing it though TB did something in addition). No change.

Then DuckDuckGo pointed me to https://www.dedoimedo.com/computers/thunderbird-email-association-error-second-fix.html. Turns out the fix is very simple, just commenting out 5 lines in the prefs.js file that relate to the Evolution Data Server (EDS). I won't go into the details, just go to the site.

content:
La procedura da seguire è questa -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/impostare-thunderbird-client-predefinito

Tuttavia sembra che tu ti riferisca alla funzione Invia a... In questo caso posso solo confermarti che dopo un aggiornamento di Windows, molti utenti non sono più riusciti ad associare Invia a... a Thunderbird

Una possibile soluzione alternativa è questa:

  1. crea un collegamento a Thunderbird sul Desktop
  2. apri la finestra Esegui di Windows con la combinazione di tasti Win+R (permi cioè il tasto Windows sulla tastiera e contemporaneamente il tasto R)
  3. digita in Esegui il comando shell:sendto e premi invio
  4. si aprirà la cartella SendTo
  5. Sposta il collegamento a Thunderbird dal Desktop a SendTo

content:
Is account on PC an imap account or a pop account ? Is account on iphone an imap account or a pop account ?

On PC: First you need to be certain the Firewall is not causing a problem. Exit Thunderbird if running. Access Firewall - this might be the default or it might be controlled by an Anti-Virus program you installed. Please make sure Thunderbird and Thunderbird updater are both set up as allowed programs.

I use Windows 10 and Norton 360 Anti-Virus. As a guide, I've posted an image below showing the settings to allow those two specific programs.

Tell me what Firewall you are using. Confirm you have set up Thunderbird and Thunderbird updater as allowed programs.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
On PC using Thunderbird. When you click on 'Get Messages' what happens ? Do you get an error mesages? If yes, post image of error message.

Quota: If imap account in Thunderbird :

  • right click on Inbox and select 'Properties'
  • click on the 'Quota' tab

What does it say ?

Need to understand what server you are trying to access and whether you have all the correct settings.

  • Click on 'Help > Troubleshooting Information'
  • Scroll down to 'Mail and News acounts' section
  • Copy all the data and paste it into this question in forum.

Logon to webmail account via a browser. Do you see all your emails on the server? If yes, they are all in the Inbox. If you have a POP account in Thunderbird - maybe a log jam has occurred. Empty the server 'Spam' folder. Then in webmail Inbox, locate the oldest but not downloaded to Thunderbird email. Read it and then either delete it or move it to another server folder. then back in Thunderbird, click on 'Get Messages'

Does it start to download emails ?

content:
What Anti-Virus are you using on the PC?

When you want to send or receive, mbox files that store emails get opened so it's possible to write to those files. If you have an Anti-Virus that scans opened files, it intervenes for a short period, so thunderbird is delayed in gaining access. On top of that Thunderbird has to contact the server to faciliate a connection and synchronisation of folders. So it updates the server with anything you do eg: move emails and send emails and the server updates Thunderbird so it can show whatever is on server.

You say your are not getting any messages - Thunderbird is acting like it's a dodo. So you need to know if it has access to the internet - allowed to use certain ports etc.

If your Firewall (which might be controlled by your Anti-Virus) does not have Thunderbird as an allowed program then it may be blocking all access to internet.

If your Anti-Virus is allowed to scan stuff eg: any file opened or uploaded or download then it may be causing a problem - so you need to make your Thunderbird profile folders exempt from scanning.

What Anti-Virus are you using ? Have you excluded Thunderbird Profile folders from being scanned ? Have you access Firewall and set up Thunderbird as an allowed program ?

Have you enabled a VPN ?....because most servers do not like VPN, they cannot get expected IP address so server thinks you a hacker and therefore does not allow access. Switch off VPN.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: I am using Webroot Anti-Virus. Most of what you are saying is like greek to me and over my head of expertise. Like I have said before, my email was working just fine on my PC up until about 2 weeks ago. I haven't done anything to change it or anything, but now it just stop.
creator: gjpiz62

content: Check to see if Thunderbird is an allowed program. check to see if all the ports used by Thunderbird are allowed. Info at this link: https://answers.webroot.com/Webroot/ukpx.aspx?app=vw&vw=1&solutionid=760

content:
In the last 5 days you have asked this question 3 times. Please don't keep repeating questions unless some time has passed eg: at least five days. I often check for older messages first, but it gest difficult if there's more than one of same question within a short period, it can mean conversations get repeated etc.

I created a test mailing list of just two people - both my own email addresses. But I deliberately removed one contact's email address. Then tried to send email and this was the result - error message.

Invalid Recipient Address Name <> is not a vaild email address because it's not of the form user@host. You must correct it before sending the email.

Maybe you are getting that particular error pop up message, so do this:

Please check and confirm that every contact selected to be in that 'Mailing List' has a valid email address. This is important because otherwise it will fail.

You said you had created a 'Mailing List' which is a sub group to an Address Book. Post a couple of images that shows: In Address Book - select the 'Mailing List' name - click on 3 dots drop down menu and select 'Edit List' Post an image that shows that pop up 'Edit List' box because we need to see what it says at the top for the List name, List nickname and description.

The 'Write' window with the name of the Mailing List in the TO, Cc or Bcc field ?

The actual error message that occurs.

content:
Contacts need to be in eg: Personal Address Book in order to put them into a Mailing List as a sub group of that address book.

The trouble is I know you can select contacts and drag and drop them into 'Personal Address Book' but it does 'move' them. You could try this: In Address Book Right click on the 'Mailing List name and select 'Export' Window opens so you can choose where to save list eg: desktop Suggest you save as LDIF file.

Then you can import : Tools > Import select 'Import from a file' and click on 'Continue' select 'Import Address Books' and click on 'Continue' select 'LDIF file' and click on 'Continue' Locate and select the saved ldif file and click on 'Open' Choose 'Personal Address Book' and click on 'Continue'

All should get imported into Personal Address Book. Then you would need to create a Mailing List. You do not need to actually manually enter each name - you can close that small window after creating name of mailing list. Make sure you can see Mailing List in left pane. select Personal Address Book to see contacts Then hold down 'Ctrl' key whilst you select/highlight a load of contacts. Left click and hold down on highlighted contacts and drag over the name of the Mailing List in left pane - release to drop into the list - much quicker than a manual entry.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
I recall over the years werid things afoot when it comes to Mailing List names. At one time any space was a problem, then it seems there was a discrepancy when it came to what was used in the three various fields as seen the 'Edit mailing list' window. Some people found the underscore worked but that was a while ago.

I've been performing some tests and so far I'm ok with spaces and underscores.

In Address Book - select the 'Mailing List' name - click on 3 dots drop down menu and select 'Edit List' Post an image that shows that pop up 'Edit List' box because we need to see what it says at the top for the List name, List nickname and description.

But in the mean time - The name of 'Mailing List' eg: C_O_NL has underscores - remove the underscores from the name leaving just spaces or no spaces. Test sending.

content:
Try this experiment.

Turn on the contact pane in your write window if it is not already enabled (F9)

Select the address list in the contact shown

This is a contact list in my list. Note the double head icon designating the list as such.

Use the buttons at the bottom of the list to add the mailing list of TO: CC: or BCC: as you choose. I chose To:

Then right click the entry in the To: or whatever field to show the menu

Select Expand list and each address in the list should appear instead of the list name. If it does, repeat the process and select send instead of expanding and see if you still see the invalid error occurs.

content:
re :I have a strange black square that appears when replying to emails. It can be moved with the cursor but won't disappear.

Post an image showing the issue because it does sound unusual.

re :In the Deleted folder, when I empty it, either using 'Empty Deleted' or manually be selecting all the messages and using the delete key, The number of messages drops to zero but the disc space is still occupied. This is in contrast to the junk folder where the operation works as expected.

On pop account and 'Local Folders' account..I get the exact opposite :) Empty Junk removes the emails, but folder has not been compacted so therefore the Size of folder will remain until Junk/Spam gets compacted. Empty Deleted removes emails and does not show size.


However, I also run a beta version of Thunderbird and Pop accounts in release version are set up as Imap accounts in this beta version. In Imap accounts : Empty Junk removes the emails, so count is not displayed but size remains, but only until I select another folder, then size is removed - so obviously a synchronsing delay. Empty Deleted removes emails, so count is not displayed but size remains, but only until I select another folder, then size is removed - so obviously a synchronsing delay.

So, in Imap accounts, I discover, the size is reduced but not until I select another folder.

But 'Local Folders' which also has a deferred pop account using it - That is the same as the release version : Empty Junk removes the emails, but folder has not been compacted so therefore the Size of folder will remain until Junk/Spam gets compacted. Empty Deleted removes emails and does not show size.

So, it seems you should get a different result depending upon whether imap or pop or Local Folders. You may also find certain servers can auto delete emails off the server if they are in the trash. Gmail do it every 30 days, but some do it every 7 days and I've even come across some that do it in less time. It means, you may have emails in Trash, you select Trash to check on them only to discover this is an imap account and the Trash has now synchronised with server and suddenly a load of emails disappear before your eyes. Imap folders can only display whatever is displayed on server.

Examples: Yahoo server does this:

  • Trash deletion frequency - Trash is deleted after 7 days.
  • Spam deletion frequency - Spam is deleted after 30 days.

Xfinity server does this:

  • Flagged spam: deleted after seven days
  • Trash: deleted after 14 days

content:
When I'm using eg: mouse to move about in the 'Reply' box my text cursor looks like a capital i with line across top and bottom. The mouse pointer icon should change to that icon when hovering in a text zone. I think it's called a I-Beam cursor. Do you see that text capital i/I-Beam type of icon ? Do you get the black box as a substitute for a text mouse cursor ?

The flashing text cursor itself is a straight line at end of text as per your image. So it's nothing to do with that.

I've been checking out various things to find out what's going on. I've found a similar cases : Some people using Windows OS discovered this was linked to their mouse pointer which normally looks like an arrow, but suddenly had a small black square with it - changing mouse pointer arrow cursor color to black instead of white solved their issue. Several people had a similar issue in Adobe a few years ago, but I think that issue was specific to an adobe update.

Do you get the same issue if typing in another program like Notepad etc? Or if typing in this forum question reply box - but you do need to make sure the mouse pointer is in the same text box area ?
creator: Toad-Hall

Are you saying you can no longer use POP with outlook? I think this MS article explains the support that you request: 

https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/modern-authentication-methods-now-needed-to-continue-syncing-outlook-email-in-non-microsoft-email-apps-c5d65390-9676-4763-b41f-d7986499a90d     I believe you should have no problem with POP
creator: davidsk

content:
TY for the link David. I am indeed saying I can no longer use POP in Outlook Mail for outlook.com email accounts. The information is confusing but I've spent hours on chat and phone calls with Microsoft agents who confirm it. Outlook emails are now stored on the Microsoft Exchange, POP downloads are not supported AND there is no way to integrate new incoming emails with my archives. It's hard to understand because Outlook still supports POP for non-Microsoft email accounts like gmail.com and yahoo.com.

I don't want to go through the hassle of changing my email accounts to gmail or another provider but I want the capacity to download, manage and archive my emails. It's been suggested I switch to Thunderbird. Before I do that I want to confirm Microsoft's "modern authentication" won't block POP downloads in the Thunderbird app as well.
creator: md.uva

content:
According to the MircoSoft information I've read (eg https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/office/pop-imap-and-smtp-settings-for-outlook-com-d088b986-291d-42b8-9564-9c414e2aa040) these settings should work:— 

Server Name: outlook.office365.com Port: 995  User Name: <your e-mail address> Connection security:  SSL/TLS Authentication method: OAuth2

  You'll usually see the port given as 993 but that is for IMAP and you want POP.

If POP no longer works, why is the settings page of Outlook covered in references to it? See screenshot below.
creator: ThePillenwerfer

The relevant bit is under Account Settings > Synchronisation & Storage.
